title.narrative: F.a: Campaign to combat violence against women

description.narrative: Sri Lanka's long civil war ended in 2009 in the victory of Sri Lankan government forces from the Tamil Tigers and to the peace agreement was preceded by extensive military operations in 2006-2009, during which took place in serious human rights and humanit arian law violations and hundreds of thousands of people were forced into internal exile. Especially the role of women is still difficult war-affected areas, as a significant proportion of them are widowed and / or injured and state assistance to these vul nerable women has been limited. The project aims to improve understanding of the organizations involved in the project and relevant stakeholders on violence against women and to promote their cooperation in order to prevent violence and intervene in it. Th e target groups are the consequences of Sri Lanka's internal conflict, the worst affected are women, and women who are victims of gendered violence. The majority of the target group living in the north and in the east. Mothers and Daughters of Lanka (MDL) is formed by 15 women's organizations in the coalition. The coalition was founded in 1989 to prevent the spread of political violence in the country and unrest
